task-wr.title: Copying the License and Optional Files to Controller-0
task-wr.shortdesc: To configure controller-0 for use, a license file and other optional files are required. You must copy these files to the host.

step.cmd: Establish a method for transferring files to the host.

info.p: You can transfer files using a network connection or an attached drive (typically a USB flash drive).

choice.p: To establish a network connection, connect the controller to the OAM network as follows:

codeblock.userinput: sudo ip addr add OAM_IP_address/mask dev port
sudo ip link set port up
sudo ip route add default via gateway_addr

choice.p: For the controller-0 port and IP address, refer to your OAM network plan.

codeblock.userinput: sudo ip addr add 10.10.10.3/24 dev eth0
sudo ip link set eth0 up
sudo ip route add default via 10.10.10.1

choice.p: Then connect a server containing the license file to the OAM network.
To use a USB drive, attach the USB flash drive to one of the available USB ports on the controller.

step.cmd: Copy the Titanium Server license file to /home/wrsroot/license.lic on the controller.

info.p: This is the default path offered during controller configuration. If you prefer, you can copy the file to a different path, and specify the path during configuration.

step.cmd: Copy a digital certificate file to the controller node.

info.p: If you require secure REST API access using HTTPS, copy a CA-signed digital certificate (PEM file) to a directory on the controller. The recommended path is /home/wrsroot. This is the default path offered during controller configuration. If you prefer, you can copy the file to a different path, and specify the path during configuration.
